instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-2924: What is 820-2924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no display. Already tried with a known good lcd and it has no image. It has image on external monitor.
It has no signs of liquids.

On F7700 I have 12.5V
<SIGNAL>ISNS_LCDBKLT_P</SIGNAL> = 12.5
<SIGNAL>ISNS_LCDBKLT_N</SIGNAL> = 0.02V
<SIGNAL>ISNS_LCDBKLT_IOUT</SIGNAL> = 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_LCDBKLT_ISENSE</SIGNAL> = 0V

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message: Is that <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> instead???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
HI,
No, it is an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
OK, you've said 2924 in the title and first post...

Do you get voltage at pins 28-30 of J8300?
At least in the first few seconds, when machine chimes.
If yes, check if <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high at same time.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Sorry, my bad...
I don't get any voltages on pins 28-30 on J8300

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message: Nor a pulse in the first seconds???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message: No, no pulse, but on pin 3 i get 5V. Do you need the other voltages on every pin?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message: Check for pulse at <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> no pulse. 0V fixed
<SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL>  i get a small pulse, but i don't think that it means nothing (0.0004V to 0.0024V).

However it seams that i don't have the right schematic, because on my board i dont have the <CAPACITOR>C8319</CAPACITOR> and the <RESISTOR>R8319</RESISTOR> that shows on my schematic. Probably this schematic is for the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Do you have the one for the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
I guess you have R/<DIODE>D8323</DIODE> instead.

You should get voltage (only for 2-3s) at L8300 even without LCD connected.
Just in case, try known good (compatible) display assembly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Hi,
I don't get anything on L8300.
I'm testing it with only the board on the desk, only with the LCD and fan conected (no disk). Does this matter?
Same result with known good LCD.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
You must check in the first few seconds, when the board chimes.
If PCH doesn't recognize the LCD, that voltage will not be maintained more time.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Hi, 
I asked a friend for help, and at the same time, he pluged the power, and I wait (unitil 1 minut) and no voltage. I don't hear the chime, because i+'m working with the board alone, but i think that i gave time to have the voltages (1 minute at least). Shel i mount the board and try it mounted?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
No need to mount it.
Just connect a spare part speaker, if available.
Also you can check USB activity for onboard USB port.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Hi,
I mounted a speaker and the same result (0V on  both pins of L8300 after the chime).
I have USB activity, and it even works well with an external monitor.

I guess that it is something wrong with my schematics and boardview. I just realise that it is showing the L8300 as the FL8300 (near J8300), and i cant find the L8300. I gues that I am measuring it in the wrong component...

However, i don't get any pulse on pins 27-30 of J8300

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Apple uses sometime different names in boardview than schematic.
However, very easi to compare with connector pin number, to avoid any confusion.

Any history fault available?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
I checked and it is connected to the pins 28-30.
I don't have any history. The client just said that the lcd stoped working and asked to replace the lcd...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Looks like PCH issue.
Check all components placed on <SIGNAL>DP_INT</SIGNAL> data lines.
Compare diode mode readings wih known good board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message:
Hi,
Can't tell what was wrong, but after gived up, i decide to do it an ultra-sound, and it worked. 5V on L8300 and i get image on lcd.
Thanks!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no display
threads.message: Possibly accumulated crap underneath PCH...
